It's no wonder that no one's surpassed her!"

limerick_list.author: skipjordan
limerick_list.text:
Oh, dungfork, to you I now sing,
As I work in my garden and fling
This well-rotted manure
Round my shrubs to ensure
Healthy growth and the blooms it will bring.

limerick_list.author: skipjordan
limerick_list.text:
For years cops had searched for McWhorter,
And it seems they have finally caught her.
Charged with blackmail, Mac was,
But, on bail, fled the fuzz.
She is now a convicted extorter.

limerick_list.author: Carol June Hooker
limerick_list.text:
In this chaffern, a large cooking pot,
Water's heated to simmering hot;
So we bathe and we boil,
Over laundry we toil,
And we stay in hot water a lot.

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
The control tower guys at the field
Tell the planes to proceed or to yield.
It's the law of the land
To obey their command—
Well, at least till the statute's repealed.

limerick_list.author: waterrocks
limerick_list.text:
He's lying — we cannot deny it —
But two can play games, so let's try it.
Since none can believe him,
This tale might deceive him
In turn. So, you reckon he'll buy it?

limerick_list.author: David Schildkret and Tim Alborn
limerick_list.text:
This morning ALCOA's top men
Were inspecting the factory, when
One got caught in the plater,
And five minutes later
Cried, "Curses, I'm foiled once again!"

limerick_list.author: Chris Doyle
limerick_list.text:
The molding that runs round the hall
In our home, near the ceiling, we call
A cavetto, whose curve,
Being concave, will serve
To keep dust farther down on the wall.

limerick_list.author: SheilaB and mephistopheles
limerick_list.text:
Joe Conservative says what he thinks,
And he doesn't use drugs, never drinks.
He is antirevolutionary
But pro-executionary—
"Kill the radicals! Death to the pinks!"

limerick_list.author: Kevin
limerick_list.text:
A boardman belongs to the board
Of a firm, such as Boeing or Jord.
His chairman presides
And, at times, overrides
His plans, which the firm can't afford.

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
What's called bitterbrush grows in the West,
On the plains, and its taste's not the best.
Though it isn't delicious,
This plant is nutritious;
The elk and deer eat it with zest.

limerick_list.author: Jesse Frankovich
limerick_list.text:
A cost of funds index: a base
For determining rates in a place
In the mortgaging scene;
It's a regional mean
That the federal banks will embrace.

limerick_list.author: Reia Light
limerick_list.text:
For child-bearing women, it's key
To consume lots of vitamin B.
Eating liver and greens
Gives me folate, which means
Better odds of a strong mini-me!

limerick_list.author: Bob Dvorak
limerick_list.text:
In the wake of the blast underground,
They went looking for gas tanks unsound.
But the tanks weren't fat —
They were empty and flat:
'Twas acetylene tanks that they found.

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
Cleopatra once ruled on the Nile,
And her figure was shapely—high style.
It would sure be a pleasure
If those curves I could measure.
Cliometrics? The thought makes me smile.

limerick_list.author: waterrocks
limerick_list.text:
The clackety metrical feet
Of the train, as I curl on my seat
In a travel-worn heap,
Almost lull me to sleep
With a cadenced and rhythmical beat.

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
Let's consider the term crustal plate.
No, it's not about toast that you ate—
Where you left crust behind—
Get that out of your mind.
It's the lithosphere's plate, and it's great.

limerick_list.author: Len Farano
limerick_list.text:
Said the churlish groom, quick to disparage
Wedding limos, "I'd use horse and carriage.
But your barn has a sign
That's the same one as mine
And my folks will disdain same-hex marriage."

limerick_list.author: Michael Toalster and SusanL
limerick_list.text:
Young Lord Plummer declared he would own
All the land he could see from his throne:
"Though this chiefdom's petite
(Just a mere toilet seat),
I will rule it myself, all alone!"

limerick_list.author: Celia Warren
limerick_list.text:
Lucy never sits still — she's a wiggler.
She wiggles and giggles, this wriggler.
She chuckles and chokes
On imaginary jokes:
She's a giggly, giggling giggler!

limerick_list.author: Sussexdownsman
limerick_list.text:
It is time that I got myself dressed.
Ought to make an attempt, do my best,
For just sitting around
In withdrawal profound
Leads, in my case, to getting depressed.

limerick_list.author: MikeAq
limerick_list.text:
"A fudgsicle, that's what I need
To alleviate heat!"  "You can plead,
But you know very well
Chocolate ice pops in Hell
Are indeed what I'd call a rare breed."

limerick_list.author: Colin Salter
limerick_list.text:
Patchy cloud! In my toolkit I grope
For my trusty old aethrioscope.
Under grey skies and clear,
See, the temperature here
Slightly varies — the 'scope gives the dope.

limerick_list.author: Miss Mimi
limerick_list.text:
Though my hair needs a do, I demur
When my friend recommends her coiffeur,
For I know that he boozes,
And nobody chooses
To be coiffed by a quaffer—no sir!

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
Half the corps claimed Tom acted misprisionally,
While the others objected collisionally.
He'd had visions and quitted
His post, he admitted.
"The troop's splitted," Tom stated divisionally.

limerick_list.author: Jesse Frankovich
limerick_list.text:
The assistant the mobster will get'll
Have muscle and law-breaking mettle,
But his brains'll be small,
And so, taking the fall,
He'll do time for the crime of abettal.

limerick_list.author: MikeAq
limerick_list.text:
To disculpate? Free someone from blame.
The word exculpate means just the same!
Some think it's absurd
To retain such a word;
Others need it for rhymes, so they claim.

limerick_list.author: Kevin Lucas
limerick_list.text:
You think things are bad now?  Just you wait.
With the Dvapara Yuga our fate
Here and now, times get worse:
Kali Yuga's a curse.
Live through that, then the Satya is great.

limerick_list.author: Jacqui Brown
limerick_list.text:
The doc made a quick diagnosis:
"You're a victim of atherosclerosis."
But some angioplasty
Compressed all the nasty
Old plaque and prevented thrombosis.

limerick_list.author: Jacqui Brown
limerick_list.text:
Tales of Beowulf, strongest of men,
Were recited again and again
In the ancestral mead hall.
Today we can read all
The sagas of heroes back then.

limerick_list.author: Val
limerick_list.text:
In debates, when you fight for a cause
And your reasons are worthy, don't pause.
Opposition political
Can be over-critical,
But colleagues will lead the applause.

limerick_list.author: Tristan
limerick_list.text:
The best phrase I ever did hear
Was quite short: "Complimentary, my dear."
There's a high price to pay
For a tedious lay,
But I think that I made her career.

limerick_list.author: Atticus Vere
limerick_list.text:
It's near Christmas—a few days before.
Ragged Belsnickel stops at your door.
Do you dare ask him in?
Well, how good have you been?
Well-behaved? You'll have presents galore.

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
In the days before Daphne was dead,
A deathwatch was held near her bed,
And as part of the vigil
An astrologer's sigil
Was painted in red on her spread.

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
When I notice this sexy young skirt,
I act charming, I smile, and I flirt.
She replies with a blunt
Brusquerie, and I grunt;
I feel hurt when a skirt is so curt.

limerick_list.author: neilski
limerick_list.text:
When they broke — a terrific sensation!
Every concert — a standing ovation!
Quickly signed them to seal
Their first five-album deal!
(Fifth one sucked. Reason was: obligation.)

limerick_list.author: Chuck Folkers
limerick_list.text:
There is little, if anything, lower
Than he who behaves like a blower.
If braggarts should roast
Down in hell, they would boast
The rotisserie they're on goes slower.

limerick_list.author: psheil
limerick_list.text:
The music was quite inharmonic;
The dissonant chords were no tonic.
All the notes were ajar—
Left my brain with a scar—
Mental pain can be stereophonic!

limerick_list.author: Paperdragon
limerick_list.text:
Bob the Builder's not right, I would say.
Can he fix it? He might do, one day.
But to make it more real
He needs to reveal
The bum-crack most builders display.

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
Although heroin all should eschew,
Apomorphine's an opiate too.
While the first's anesthetic,
The second's emetic;
Don't try it—you'll barf if you do.

limerick_list.author: Bluebelle
limerick_list.text:
Jersey yellow, or fat-reduced white,
At the top of the milk, day and night,
In my lactose-filled dream,
As I sup on the cream,
I take more of a slurp than a bite.

limerick_list.author: mephistopheles
limerick_list.text:
This tragedy's plotline won't work
Since the hero's a two-timing jerk:
Hamlet acts quite the heel,
Briefly copping a feel
Before dropping Ophelia—for Dirk!

limerick_list.author: VERaLOE
limerick_list.text:
At school I was simply a fool.
I preferred to play boules and to drool.
My attention diminished,
Long before I had finished—
As a rule I went straight to the pool.

limerick_list.author: Chuck Folkers
limerick_list.text:
If calvities can't be forestalled
(As my hair loss is technically called),
I will bridge the divide
Combing up from the side.
Not a soul will suspect that I'm bald.

limerick_list.author: speedysnail
limerick_list.text:
Dear Catherine went out for a chat
On the balcony up in her flat,
But was feeling unwell,
Missed the railing, and fell,
Catastrophically ending with splat.

limerick_list.author: Qermaq
limerick_list.text:
Little Akbar, who once was a chap
Ruling India, stood for no crap.
But today, the poor Moghul
Would sit there and ogle
Us begging him, "Say 'It's a trap!'"

limerick_list.author: Len Farano
limerick_list.text:
Though his S.A.T. scores all had caved,
Your son's path to the Ivies was paved.
It'll cost you X grand
To admit.  It's the land
Of the "G" and the home of the waived.

limerick_list.author: Chris J. Strolin
limerick_list.text:
"Robert Jones, twenty bucks, 1 July,
Then ten more on the fifth from McFly."
The name that exists
For who-pays-what-when lists?
Aging schedules, but don't ask me why.

limerick_list.author: geniuswaitress
limerick_list.text:
Cagliostro? A mystical guy,
He gave magic and Masons a try.
But the rest of his history
Is secret — a mystery.
I'd tell you, but then you must die.

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
When my headaches caused anguish and groans,
I took herbs that to me were unknowns,
Then got fractures. I guess
They demineralized—yes,
Leached the calcium out of my bones.

limerick_list.author: Len Farano
limerick_list.text:
Liner Costa Concordia sank
When the ship ran aground on a bank.
Several passengers died
As it lay on its side,
And the captain's performance was rank.

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
There are luxury items galore
You can buy at the company store.
You may spend all you get;
Then you'll wind up in debt
To the boss, who will profit the more.

limerick_list.author: Graham Lester
limerick_list.text:
My antidepression drug's great.
I used to be sad and sedate,
Now I'm smiley and perky —
In love with a turkey!
Best quit it before it's too late.

limerick_list.author: birdbarf
limerick_list.text:
Used by Audubon, arsenic was
A preservative needed because
As insecticide, he
Could keep bird skins bug-free.
Its sweet almond smell stays, yes it does.

limerick_list.author: MikeAq
limerick_list.text:
Why, yes, girl-watching's something I do
As we stroll through the park or the zoo.
But I want you to know
That wherever we go,
The gazing is best when at you!

limerick_list.author: Andrew Burnet
limerick_list.text:
I find alcohol most efficacious
In making the shy more loquacious.
Its effects (still more drastic)
On knicker elastic
Can make the flirtatious audacious.

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
As a person in perfect control
Of my future, through goal after goal,
Their attainment I slate
For a far-distant date
(When I hope to be out on parole).

limerick_list.author: Doug Aldridge
limerick_list.text:
The deft gymnast arcuately bent
Her spine backward as far as it went.
She resembled a bow
'Til her head touched her toe
And her coach yelled, "That's more than I meant!"

limerick_list.author: Dottie
limerick_list.text:
My aunt's got a face like a hatchet
And a vicious bad temper to match it.
I've escaped her thus far—
Now I've damaged her car!
If I scratch and don't patch it, I'll catch it….

limerick_list.author: stmpngblsmz
limerick_list.text:
I recently spoke with the Reaper.
He told me your soul was a keeper.
Life's too precious, you reckon,
To succumb to his beckon,
But the price of elusion is steeper.

limerick_list.author: Roger Vick
limerick_list.text:
When in college, it feels like a club
As you frequent the common, the hub.
And at meal times you enter
This gathering centre
For grub. Sorry, chum, there's no pub.

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
King Odysseus was wily and sly.
In the cave of the Cyclops, he'd try
To escape with his men.
First he counted to ten,
Then cried, "Blimey! Here's blood in your eye!"
 
The Cyclops had fallen asleep,
And was blinded—a stroke that went deep
In the monster's one eye.
Then they bade him goodbye
As they clung to the bellies of sheep.

limerick_list.author: Dr The Momm
limerick_list.text:
A glioblastoma is horrible,
A cancer malign and deplorable.
It causes much pain;
Does no good to complain.
This cancer is never ignorable.

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
Blennophobia? Every time
You've a cold, it's much less than sublime,
As with each messy sneeze
You feel more ill at ease;
It's a horror of mucus and slime.

limerick_list.author: Atticus Vere
limerick_list.text:
The best gandy dancers lay all our rails.
(Hear them chant as they're busting their tails.)
Misalignments, warped ties
Don't escape their keen eyes:
For our rolling stock, safety prevails.

limerick_list.author: Kevin Lucas
limerick_list.text:
My exit exam?  Hey, no prob.
Aced the sucker!  The Radical Mob
Was my major in school.
I have mastered mob rule,
But this graduate can't find a job.

limerick_list.author: Brent Annable
limerick_list.text:
The PPSh-41
Is a Soviet-patented gun
That confirms in a trice
A good piece of advice:
If a burp's coming up, you should run!

limerick_list.author: Chris J. Strolin
limerick_list.text:
Though the sulfur it belches may stink so,
It's the name that makes newsreaders sink so.
Sixteen letters! That group
Looks like alphabet soup.
And three j's in one word? I don't think so!

limerick_list.author: R. A. Shortfellow
limerick_list.text:
She was working a crossword; asked, "What
Does capitulate mean? I forgot."
I thought and I thought
But could come up with naught.
"I give up!" "That will fit. Thanks a lot!"

limerick_list.author: Kevin Lucas
limerick_list.text:
Nostalgic for love gone awry,
I had called her and asked, "One more try?"
I appealed to romance,
But she screamed, "Not a chance!"
And an antisentimental "Goodbye!"

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
A fornicatress is, says the bard,
An adultress whose life may be hard,
And her fate caught in deadlock.
She has sex out of wedlock;
If she's caught, her repute will be marred.

limerick_list.author: MikeAq
limerick_list.text:
Substitution I taught by degrees
To my secret French lover, Louise.
I used  u, o, and i
To encrypt  a, n, y;
So her nays were transformed into ouis!

limerick_list.author: Atticus Vere
limerick_list.text:
Propagation by cuttage retains
The good traits of developing strains.
One plant's bearing more beans?
Then treasure its genes:
Take cuttings, implant them—take pains.

limerick_list.author: Mary
limerick_list.text:
Right here's where your logic is rough:
You've assumed your conclusion. It's tough,
But the fact we have eyes
Doesn't prove your surmise.
We're not perfect. We're "just good enough."

limerick_list.author: Joanna Keene
limerick_list.text:
Flying insects have been in decline:
Just one-quarter* remain; that's not fine —
Not for frogs nor for birds
Nor for us who write words:
When we're gone, there'll be no one to pine.

limerick_list.author: Bluebelle
limerick_list.text:
Oh, Honey, let's just go away!
We won't need stacks of money to pay
For a short city break—
Grab a few things to take
To Berlin for an overnight stay.

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
I've exceptional talent within,
And my handwriting's neat as a pin,
But each morning and night
When I sit down to write,
I just never know where to begin.

limerick_list.author: Atticus Vere
limerick_list.text:
The red on the barber's white pole
That sits on a blood-letting bowl:
Is he feeding his leeches
On clients, while each is
Re-trimmed — their original goal?

limerick_list.author: proof
limerick_list.text:
In some walks of life it is handy
To dress well and look like eye candy.
It may get you ahead
To appear so well-bred,
Though some folks might call you a dandy.

limerick_list.author: Roger Dunn
limerick_list.text:
My back passage's haemorrhoids hurt.
My GP said, on lifting my shirt,
"Your suppositories won't
Do the trick if you don't
Take the foil off — while wrapped, they're inert."

limerick_list.author: Mr E S
limerick_list.text:
Your marrow's erythropoietic,
A process that's quite copacetic,
Unless it for you
Makes too many or few
New red blood cells.  That could be pathetic.

limerick_list.author: Kevin Lucas
limerick_list.text:
My new lover had got me bumfuzzled.
I felt so confused as we nuzzled.
I'd thought I was straight,
But the urge was too great.
Now I'm happily gay and not puzzled.

limerick_list.author: Ruchiccio
limerick_list.text:
I had told my hotel clerk, "Devise
A help-wanted display board. Its size
Should be large, its font bold."
Said his poster in gold:
SEEKING YOUNG INN-EXPERIENCED GUYS.

limerick_list.author: Chris J. Strolin
limerick_list.text:
My great-grandad, the back washer, said,
"Way back when, all the work was co-ed,
But the job title's bull!
All we washed was the wool.
From day one, I was greatly misled."

limerick_list.author: Jane Auerbach
limerick_list.text:
Veggies strewn on a plate like confetti
Are brunoise.  The chef got them ready
By dicing real fine
(One-eighth inch is divine)
While she's keeping her knife sharp and steady.

limerick_list.author: AndrewB
limerick_list.text:
This woman behaves as a man —
She wears pants, smokes cigars when she can!
We men mustn't allow
Her george-sandism — how
Can we stop her outrageous new plan?

limerick_list.author: Kevin
limerick_list.text:
At Bannockburn, Robert the Bruce
Was prudent, but cool and quite douce.
Though the English did rattle,
His Scots won the battle:
King Edward was chased like a goose.

limerick_list.author: Amanda Richards
limerick_list.text:
Cytophotometrically, students can tell
All the compounds that make up a cell
By staining a section
For closer inspection —
Once they use the photometer well.

limerick_list.author: Dottie
limerick_list.text:
A bird-loving chappie in Cromer
Bought a pigeon; they called it a homer.
But it wouldn't be caught
In that North Norfolk port!
Seems that homer must be a misnomer.

limerick_list.author: Atticus Vere
limerick_list.text:
Copulation's my lifelong obsession,
So sleep's but a squandered digression.
In the words of my ex,
"God knows you love sex."
(If God knows, then I'm skipping confession.)

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
Many doctors acquire expertise
Treating collagen tissue disease.
Scleroderma and lupus—
Conditions that poop us—
Bring even the strong to their knees.

limerick_list.author: Howard Spindel
limerick_list.text:
Lopped.
Cropped.
Cut.
What?
Chopped!

limerick_list.author: Kevin Lucas
limerick_list.text:
There oughta be some kind of law
When the gals in the office all jaw
About babies.  Obsessing,
They're always expressing
Delight with that sugary "Awwwww!"

limerick_list.author: zqms
limerick_list.text:
After racism's logical end,
Down to colourism bigots descend.
They don't care about race;
Just the hue of your face
Means to them you are scum or their friend.

limerick_list.author: Chris J. Strolin
limerick_list.text:
The first finger? I'm sure you have viewed one.
Every hand you see's bound to include one.
Called the pointer by some,
It sits next to the thumb.
Next one over, of course, is the rude one.

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
"I've two words.  They are cuddy and cubby.
They can mean just the same," said my hubby.
"That is, 'pantry or closet'
Where I'll make a deposit,
But I can't fit inside. I'm too chubby."

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
"If you're eager to swim in these pools,
You're obliged to obey my three rules:
Firstly, second, and third
(Though the third is absurd),
"No diving, no glass, no damned fools!"

limerick_list.author: Howard Spindel
limerick_list.text:
It's competitive, here on this cruise;
Every team has a color they choose.
In the cabin next door,
They chose red for their corps.
As for us, we're the berth of the blues.

limerick_list.author: Chris J. Strolin
limerick_list.text:
It's a cage ball. It stands six feet tall,
And it's used in a supervised brawl.
Teams of kids push and shove it,
Their schoolteachers love it,
But, oddly, there's no cage at all.

limerick_list.author: rusty
limerick_list.text:
There's ferment and foment re formant,
The meaning of which causes torment.
In the vocalist's art,
It's a resonant part
Of one's range. In phonetics, there's more meant.

limerick_list.author: Brian Cairns
limerick_list.text:
My accounts are long since in the red,
I've made firewood of table and bed,
All my assets are sold,
I've no silver, no gold:
I am bankrupt.  Your bill won't get paid.

limerick_list.author: John Critten
limerick_list.text:
My work's gonna take me from here.
I'm moving to Seoul for a year.
It's not a daft notion.
For me it's promotion.
It will boost me by way of Korea.

limerick_list.author: FlippingMackerel
limerick_list.text:
I stare at that blank-canvas hue
And it seems to declare, "Entre nous,
Colour me? My complaint:
If you dare try to paint
Over me, I'll decolourize you!"

limerick_list.author: Taillefer
limerick_list.text:
My wife reads my limericks first,
And each time I assume that she'll burst
With laughter. But, no:
"Line 5 just doesn't go."
The results of this field test? I'm cursed.

limerick_list.author: Atticus Vere
limerick_list.text:
"Let's go clubbing, and do it up brown."
"But the upstream marina's shut down:
River's closed due to blockage."
"The harbor's got dockage.
Tie up; we can hitchhike to town."

limerick_list.author: S. A. McBurnie
limerick_list.text:
The cigar and the scowl we recall,
The avowal to stand or to fall,
Wry wit, stubborn poses,
The gardener's roses:
Churchillian memories all.

limerick_list.author: Celia Warren
limerick_list.text:
As a geocacher, Georgie will read
Geographical markers that lead
To where he is bidden
To find something hidden.
With GPS help, he'll succeed.

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
He woke up one morning amnesiac
After taking a strong aphrodisiac,
Without knowing his name
Promptly stripped and became
An anonymous male Dionysiac.

limerick_list.author: JimInRoses
limerick_list.text:
Ctenizidae (now Ctenizoidea)
In their homebuilding might have employed ya
To conceal their trap-doors
In the cool forest floors;
But, as spiders, they'd rather avoid ya.

limerick_list.author: Chris J. Strolin
limerick_list.text:
You say deafness is what you are fearing,
As a silent old age you are nearing?
And your spouse is suggesting
More medical testing?
Acoumetry measures your hearing.

limerick_list.author: Jonathan Caws-Elwitt
limerick_list.text:
Dear Writer: Your style is elastic,
Your imagery fluid and plastic.
But — my! — how pretentious.
Don't think me tendentious,
My friend, when I call it bombastic.

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
Though for weeks, in preparing, I've toiled,
Now my plans for a picnic are foiled.
Weather forecasts inform
Us we're in for a storm,
So all outdoor events will be spoiled.

limerick_list.author: timon
limerick_list.text:
Seeking peace by the waterside, angling
Pleases many; but some fishes, wrangling
About proper quotas,
Worry anti-sports voters.
(My modifiers seem to be dangling.)

limerick_list.author: John Critten
limerick_list.text:
Regard apomorphic statistics,
And study related cladistics.
They suggest Darwin, C.
Was correct, or should we
Just go back to believing in mystics?

limerick_list.author: rusty
Taillefer
limerick_list.text:
The station is blazing, on fire,
With flames getting higher and higher,
But its fire brigade
Is away, I'm afraid—
And besides, they are stuck (a flat tyre).

limerick_list.author: oneslowtyper
limerick_list.text:
When abligurition prevails,
Instead of some fries I'll eat snails.
I won't care about taste,
Nor the money I'll waste.
Were they pricey, I'd eat monkey tails.

limerick_list.author: Chris Doyle
limerick_list.text:
Tom Brady is sharp as a tack,
Flinging passes, avoiding the sack.
There'll be Super Bowl cheers
For New England—this year's
Yet another for pats on the back.

limerick_list.author: David
limerick_list.text:
A swimmer embarked on a quest
To discover which stroke she liked best,
So her coach, with his hands
Stroking muscles and glands,
Showed the stroke she liked best was the breast.

limerick_list.author: MikeAq
limerick_list.text:
As her tears flowed with no explanations
But babbling, I vented frustrations:
"Your excess lachrymosity
And streaming verbosity?
Torrents of mad exudations!"

limerick_list.author: Meg Beagle
limerick_list.text:
Poor me, I'm so fiercely athirst.
He who emptied my bowl is now cursed!
I need my fresh water.
Fill my bowl!  I'm your daughter!
I'd thrive if our roles were reversed.

limerick_list.author: Chris J. Strolin
limerick_list.text:
Her radiant smile expressed joy
As she lay on the beach in St Croix.
She was beaming. Tom Cruise
Then delivered great news:
"Congratulations, my love. It's a boy!"

limerick_list.author: turnip
limerick_list.text:
Your acoustic (Hello?  Hello?) tolerance
Seems greatest when I have to holler rants
About clogging the drain,
Yet you suffer great pain
When I whisper, "Please lend me a dollar, Rance."

limerick_list.author: Atticus Vere
limerick_list.text:
Our executive: how he's enstyled
Must be set, be he loved or reviled.
"Your High Mightiness," "sire,"
Or "This Flintlock for Hire"?
"Mr. President"—forceful, yet mild.

limerick_list.author: mike scholtes
limerick_list.text:
In Phnom Penh, happy pizza is strong,
But they'll get you riel for a song.
Go to see Angkor Wat;
They like bucks, they like baht,
And will gladly accept your new dong.

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
Brass buttons I hope to promote;
Not the ones on a commodore's coat,
But those bright yellow flowers
Girls plant in their bowers
For guys upon whom they may dote.

limerick_list.author: Buonarotti
limerick_list.text:
He awoke in the 25th century
A.D. in a world of adventure.  He
Had aged about zero,
Buck Rogers, our hero.
Activities?  Plenipotentiary.

limerick_list.author: Bill Cernansky
limerick_list.text:
Baby leans back and opens his throat
Gobbling Cheerios, ringlets of oat.
He devours whole bowls
But the pieces have holes,
So the chances he'll choke are remote.

limerick_list.author: Celia Warren
limerick_list.text:
As I'm flipping between and betwixt,
I find switches seem faultily fixed.
When I press a switch down,
Lights go off, so I frown.
Seems the ons and the offs are up-mixed.

limerick_list.author: JimInRoses
Roger Dunn
limerick_list.text:
A camshaft's eccentric lobes bear
On the cylinders' valve stems; it's where,
Once a rev, lobes apply
In-line motion whereby
Valves are opened to fuel or to air.

limerick_list.author: David Schildkret
limerick_list.text:
My limerick muse is all spent.
She has left, and who knows where she went?
Amuse?  I cannot,
For my rhyming is shot.
I shall have to invent a lament.

limerick_list.author: Janet McConnaughey
limerick_list.text:
Once most worthy (desertive) and true,
She became a desertress who'd spew
Such despicable muck
That the guards made her suck
A detersive, like soap or shampoo.

limerick_list.author: Anonymity
limerick_list.text:
To embellish this building's design,
I made use of a pattern divine.
It resembles a maze—
The Greek fret! It displays
An unbroken, meandering line.

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
See the ulcer in Fido's right eye?
Well, it scared me. I feared he might die,
Descemetocele's what
The new vet says he's got.
With these drops, it will heal by and by.

limerick_list.author: Val
limerick_list.text:
It's his arrogance holding the floor
As he talks like his word should be law.
I'd like to rebel
With a firm, "Go to hell—
You obnoxious unspeakable bore!"

limerick_list.author: J. E. Pettit
limerick_list.text:
PTL MATM XTLR, TGW MHHD RHN GH MBFX?
MAXG IXKATIL RHN TKX LFTKMXK MATG B'F.
PXEE, BM'L MBFX MH IKXITKX
YHK MAX GXQM (ABGML: T LJNTKX,
TGW MAX GNFUXK YBOX IHLBMBOX IKBFX).

limerick_list.author: turnip
limerick_list.text:
Wrote a book, but don't know what comes next?
Get a book agent, send her your text.
If she knows how to schmooze,
Buys the publishers booze,
Then your writing career won't be hexed.

limerick_list.author: Richard English
limerick_list.text:
They mine fireclay,  a kind of a clay
Used for strong furnace linings that may
Be then used in great heat
Which would others defeat —
It makes sure that these walls don't decay.

limerick_list.author: Janet McConnaughey
Graig Gigol
limerick_list.text:
Said a cheese-making master, Herr Kessel,
"When you're making some cheese, you don't wrestle.
No bare-handed squeeze
Will make a good cheese;
You need to squeeze cheese in a chessel."

limerick_list.author: stella
limerick_list.text:
The chatroom's a place some folks greet
Other folks they don't see on the street.
They connect by computer;
If I was astuter,
I'd link when those other folks meet.

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
"Pesky a's slipping in," howled Ed Powell.
"Let's disclaim them—don't throw in the towel.
Only fools will write aegis
Seeking honor prestigious!"
That's Powell's supreme disavowal.

limerick_list.author: Sussexdownsman
limerick_list.text:
In his manger the Christ child lies sleeping,
While the world goes on warring and weeping.
For peace we are yearning
As Earth goes on turning
And angels a vigil are keeping.

limerick_list.author: bob killian
limerick_list.text:
Read this bio of Einstein, contriving
To clarify; still I am striving
To fathom his quote
In that famed anecdote:
"When is Zurich to this train arriving?"

limerick_list.author: Celia Warren
limerick_list.text:
My green-fingered brothers are so
Very clever at making plants grow,
Their touch so adept,
Even weeds they have kept
Growing tall — although why, I don't know.

limerick_list.author: rusty
limerick_list.text:
Churches teach 'em God's ways we can't know.
Church's theorem compares. That is so!
With a nod to Kurt Gödel
(Who'd cleared one big hurdle),
It proves there are truths we can't show.

limerick_list.author: Chris Doyle
limerick_list.text:
While constructing a cupboard, a jerk
In the White House declares with a smirk,
"Let ol' Condi and Rummy
Both call me a dummy—
I'm proud of my cabinetwork."

limerick_list.author: Kevin Lucas
limerick_list.text:
In your bandwagon fallacy, you
Are supporting a popular view
That may counter the facts,
But because it attracts
Many people, you take it as true.

limerick_list.author: Roger Dunn
limerick_list.text:
The girl's hip pains had vanished for good
As the healer had promised they would.
Getting rid of her crutch
Was the finishing touch
And she walked like a normal girl should.

limerick_list.author: speedysnail
limerick_list.text:
The antilibertarian view
Is that rulers know better than you:
Your rights and free will
Take particular skill
To subvert, undermine and undo.

limerick_list.author: Frank Luke
limerick_list.text:
This news agency transmits the views
Of what Arabs receive in their news.
Let's hope that this aids
In quelling the raids
Now raging 'tween Arabs and Jews.

limerick_list.author: Chris Doyle
limerick_list.text:
He's a courteous colleague, it's true,
But his absence of schooling won't do.
Academical study
Will help make your buddy
A scholar and gentleman, too.

limerick_list.author: Janet McConnaughey
limerick_list.text:
Their cries are high kees, and not squawks.
They fly low to the ground, since the stalks
And the leaves hide their prey.
They are active by day.
This Circus is full of small hawks.

limerick_list.author: Carol June Hooker
limerick_list.text:
As Sandi sat stroking the pup,
Affectional urges surged: "Yup,
I'll buy him," she said,
"And I'll get a dog bed,
And Manolo high heels to chew up."

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
With this limerick, autoschediastical,
I offer, I hope, a first-class tickle.
It's improvised—yes—
And I'm sure you can guess
That I aim for no less than a mass tickle.

limerick_list.author: Bill Cernansky
limerick_list.text:
Absentmindedness, I have been taught
Is forgetting things that you should not,
Such as failing to do
What's expected of you,
Or like when you ... oh hell, I forgot.

limerick_list.author: mephistopheles
limerick_list.text:
Though it isn't the word we would use,
She describes her career as danseuse,
As the swan she portrays
In her latest ballets
Tends to trip on the lace of her sheuse.

limerick_list.author: Chris Doyle
limerick_list.text:
For the physicist, deuterons seem
To engender respect and esteem.
If he's looking for "cool,"
Antideuterons rule—
And together, the two are a scream!

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
I was asked for advice by Ms. Reno:
"My doc says excessive amino
Acids race through my blood,
So I fear it's like mud!"
"For aminoacidemia: vino!"

limerick_list.author: Tim Alborn
limerick_list.text:
The chinook took a look, as it swam;
"I'm a schnook! It's the Bonneville Dam!
All its monstrous concrete
Will mean certain defeat!
I'm a sorrowful salmon, I am!"

limerick_list.author: John Wellington Wells
limerick_list.text:
"A man's either moral or not,"
Said Professor Immanuel Schott.
But what about mice?
Are they evil, or nice?
His reply, "They're amoral, you snot."

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
His poems were pointed and terse.
"Life in prison," he wrote, "can't be worse.
As I sit all alone
With no friends and no phone,
I'm aware of the need for con verse."

limerick_list.author: Gtmac
limerick_list.text:
Eating soup up on deck before noon,
I hastily laid down my spoon.
At the call "Whales are near!"
I grabbed my barbed spear,
Preparing to throw the harpoon.

limerick_list.author: psheil
limerick_list.text:
This word that I'm trying to think of
Means "of or pertaining to ink". Of
Such thoughts that torment us ...
Of course, atramentous!
It's not what I'd take a short drink of!

limerick_list.author: Kevin Lucas
limerick_list.text:
Blanket statements aren't those that are said
When we're under the covers in bed.
All-encompassing, broad —
This is how they are flawed.
Therefore, all men are pigs has no cred.

limerick_list.author: Chris Doyle
limerick_list.text:
To bad-talk a person implies
That he's someone you scorn or despise.
Are the brickbats you hurl
'Cause he's stolen the girl
You adore out from under your eyes?

limerick_list.author: Bill Dorner
limerick_list.text:
Though male cabbies make Gwendolyn wary,
Uber sends every Tom, Dick, or Harry,
And it makes her so mad
That her driver's a lad
Every time that she tries to hail Mary.

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
He digs troughs along roads for the rich.
Now his girlfriend is itching to switch,
So this bitch makes a pitch
In a letter, in which
She says, "Mitch, I am planning a ditch."

limerick_list.author: David Schildkret
limerick_list.text:
Her beckoning glance had allured me,
Her luscious red lips reassured me.
I succumbed to her charms
And fell into her arms,
But one whiff of her breath quickly cured me.

limerick_list.author: woodfostersmith
limerick_list.text:
Baroclinity-based weather data
Pertains to the tilted air strata
That, when they get spinning,
May cause some tree thinning,
And make your backyard a lot flatta.

limerick_list.author: StephenGold
limerick_list.text:
Through my drug clinic's garden I pass.
Who erected this notice? What ass?
Though I'm weaning off weed,
I don't need to re-read
Endless edicts to "Keep Off The Grass!"

limerick_list.author: Chris Doyle
limerick_list.text:
To be born to the manner's a boon.
In your mouth is a silvery spoon.
While you're still in a diaper,
Let dad pay the piper.
The advantage is you call the tune.

limerick_list.author: Atticus Vere
limerick_list.text:
Boss, when word of this screw-up gets loose,
We fall back on our well-worn excuse:
You were clueless; confess it.
The press? They won't press it.
They're toadies; let's put them to use.

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
Caveman Dana has tools made of stone,
And his core tools he makes on his own.
As he chips away flakes
From the stone core, he makes
A fine axe that's much sharper than bone.

limerick_list.author: Chris J. Strolin
limerick_list.text:
I'd been warned, so I kept my eyes peeled
For his blooper. A homer would yield
A sure win for my team,
But the other extreme
Was my blooper to short centerfield.

limerick_list.author: Janet McConnaughey
limerick_list.text:
"The Micks, scurvy scum without graces,
Wear their hair, matted up, on their faces.
Hairdos can't be ad lib,"
Ruled King Henry. "The glib
Is illegal. That covers all cases."

limerick_list.author: Celia Warren
limerick_list.text:
There were holes in old Billy's net curtain
Caused by cigarette-ends, I am certain.
But if Billy won't learn
From one cigarette burn,
Soon his whole house will go for a Burton.

limerick_list.author: R. A. Shortfellow
limerick_list.text:
You think you're so hip, cool and mod,
But everyone else thinks you're fade:
Insipid and trite,
Homo sapiens lite.
You are commonplace, not even odd.

limerick_list.author: Andrew Burnet
limerick_list.text:
When the English invade, what to do?
Strap a kilt on and paint your face blue.
And the facts? We don't need 'em—
It's all about 'Freedom!'
Who cares if the details aren't true?

limerick_list.author: Sussexdownsman
limerick_list.text:
Having promised to hold land just won,
A frontiersman was helped by a gun
To remain "on the edge"
Of the new world. This pledge
He had made for a place in the sun.

limerick_list.author: A. M. Warren
limerick_list.text:
Some kid in PE told a shocker:
Bacteria lived in his locker!
(What bio-class beaker's
As rich as old sneakers
And socks full of microbes from soccer?)

limerick_list.author: Ruchiccio
limerick_list.text:
Mom has babies one after another—
Just today I received a new brother!
Now my dad's recommending
A childbearing ending:
"We're calling it Quits, me and Mother."

limerick_list.author: GeneralE
limerick_list.text:
For proportions that seem quite immense,
The term biblical makes the most sense.
From Goliath's great height
To Leviathan's might,
It's a scale of outlandish extents.

limerick_list.author: David
limerick_list.text:
Blenheim Palace (that's BLEN-uhm to you)
Isn't cool as a pad, dude, it's true,
But it has got a claim
On hip Woodstock's great name —
And some Churchill guy lived there once, too.

limerick_list.author: Jeff Foster
limerick_list.text:
Said the butcher, "What's left on my block
I dissever and package and stock.
But there's little demand
For my lopped-off right hand,
Or the bits of it left on my smock."

limerick_list.author: mephistopheles
limerick_list.text:
"The selection procedure was screwy—
The criteria listed were hooey!
When the Navy picked Dewey,
They screwed us.  Oh, phooey!"
Griped Admirals Huey and Louie.

limerick_list.author: Jesse Frankovich
limerick_list.text:
Camelopardalis stargazers spy
In the north, and two bears are nearby.
Though not much of a sight
('Cause it isn't too bright),
This giraffe's lengthy neck is sky-high!

limerick_list.author: mephistopheles
limerick_list.text:
The cnidarian body is made
With a radial floor-plan displayed:
The umbrella or bell
Holds the stomach as well;
'Round its mouth are the nettles arrayed.

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
The critic had seemed altruistic
Till I read his report, dysphemistic.
"This smearer of paint
Shows," he wrote, "no restraint."
(Momma tells me my work is artistic.)

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
As a schoolboy who crawls like a snail,
He procrastinates, cannot prevail.
If you fill the child's head,
And on textbooks he's fed,
As adult he's unlikely to fail.

limerick_list.author: Giorgio Coniglio
limerick_list.text:
For most 'bee stings' the bees take the fall,
Though it isn't the bees' fault at all;
Vespine pests, yellow jackets
Undertake an attack; it's
A typical day's ER call.

limerick_list.author: Chris Doyle
limerick_list.text:
I'm down in the dumps with the bluesman,
That sad-about-paying-my-duesman.
My spirits are low,
So I'm tempted to go
To the bar and imbibe with the boozeman.

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
With his knowledge encyclopediacal,
Connie's cousin is hypochondriacal,
But he hates taking pills.
As a cure for his ills
He swigs booze and is dipsomaniacal.

text: This is a test to see how well you are paying attention. This text is a series of limericks. At the end of the list of limericks, there will be a question. The question will be about one of the limericks. Please answer the question as concisely as possible.
